snippet: The new truce began at 12:01 a.m. Monday, after both sides agreed to a resumption of Egyptian-mediated negotiations toward a more durable solution.
abstract: Israeli and Palestinian negotiators accept Egypt's proposal for new 72-hour cease-fire in Gaza fighting, and agree to resume Egyptian-mediated negotiations toward more durable solution; it remains unclear whether sides have moved nearer to agreement on contested issues.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and MERNA THOMAS
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Merna Thomas from Cairo. Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo, and Fares Akram from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: The new truce began at 12:01 a.m. Monday, after both sides agreed to a resumption of Egyptian-mediated negotiations toward a more durable solution.

headline.main: Agreeing to More Talks in Egypt, Israelis and Palestinians Begin Latest Cease-Fire
headline.print_headline: Agreeing to More Talks in Egypt, Israelis and Palestinians Begin Latest Cease-Fire
